Summary: I made a last minute reservation, and didn't read reviews beforehand.   The hotel is right off the freeway and the rooms we stayed in overlooked the freeway traffic.  The balcony door did a good job of keeping the freeway noise out, but the same cannot be said of the paper thin walls. We asked to be moved to the upper floor because the first morning we were awaken by what sounded like stumping elephants upstairs, but were just guests walking.  If you sleep with earplugs that would not be a problem, but we don't.  There still seems to be an issue with the card keys having to be reprogrammed.  It happened to us both nights when we returned to the room(s).  We did not use the swimming pool, but it honestly looked kind of small and sad, surrounded by walls.  Anyway, the hotel has
Room tip: Ask for a room on the third floor and bring your earplugs.

I saw your message, and I am sorry that your stay was not excellent. I understand your disappointment about these matters. Furthermore, I sent your review to our managers. Summary: Tried to take advantage of "low" season coming in with the Mrs. on a late- Feb 2022 weekend, but the jokes on me as its safe to say, this, or any other city in Southern California, has NO low season anymore after covid. Hotel is tucked away behind the top of a steep slope next to I-5 south at the end of a sad and lifeless shopping plaza. At the base of the slope you have a pizza place, Pho place, 99 cent store, a gym, and a few other rinky-dink businesses.  Very clean and quiet. Lots of reviews mentioned thin walls and noise, didn't hear a peep. Friday night was empty, Saturday pretty full, but slept very well. Clean, modern look like the Hampton Inn that i love. Great smelling and remodeled new lobby, halls etc. Pillows were too soft sank in them even 2 on top of each other;
Room tip: 3rd floor facing outlets for peace and quiet
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, but few issues need to be addressed
Summary: This is the second time we stayed here.  First time a few months ago was a better stay.  Rooms are decent and clean.  Staff here were all friendly.  The door key system is out of date and we had constant problems with it.  We literally couldn't get into our room upon returning each night.  I had to have my room keys re-keyed every day.  The desk told me that I probably left the key near my cell phone or in my wallet and that's why it needed to be rekeyed.  I did the first time, but made sure to keep it entirely separate the rest of the stay.  They didn't work.  We had to change rooms after the first night because they concluded our door lock was broken.  We had difficulties with the second room also, and saw many other guess having similar problems.  The ceilings must be quite
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean, neat , modern, comfortable and spotless  bedding, coffee and tea in room,  warm  great pressure shower, friendly and helpful staff. Cozy outdoor sitting area with fireplace, basketball hoop , small pool.  We definitely will come back.  Thank you Holiday Inn express for your exceptional service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can’t even express how amazing Kevin and Cat were. I mean they treated my like I was a celebrity or something. And the welcoming smiles were the first thing that greeted me as I approached. I would definitely stay again and I have already shared with others my experience!!! Thanks again and we will see you again!

Summary: Me and my boyfriend come here frequently. Kevin, the front desk manager attends us very well. Rooms are clean, staff is helpful, and he always allows me a late checkout which works great for my studying.   Thanks Kevin!
Manager Response: none

Summary: A Lil bit of Heaven indeed. An absolute gem of a hotel located in beautiful San Clemente with a very peaceful stay for 4 months making me want to even come here for a vacation in future when Colorado gets too hot or cold.  The beach walks and bluff trails along the azure ocean coast and wide open ocean sky, were only a stone's throw away from the Holiday Inn Express San Clemente, were very pleasant and pleasing indeed, a real escape from the bustling world, with a shopping mall and excellent restaurants nearby make The Holiday Inn Express at San Clemente one of the best locations in the world I have stayed at. The staff, including Guzy, James, Jenny, Jack, Patrik, Kat, Frank, Rosa, Guadaloupe, Patty, and Rudy, are the most caring heart-felt people and are a true asset to the
Room tip: The upper floor in the middle is quieter.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in San Clemente!!
Summary: From the beginning, our stay was absolutely fantastic.  Upon arrival, we received a friendly greeting from the Front Desk staff and were given some good advise about our stay and travel plans.  The room was clean and neat.  After returning from our travels, we again received a warm welcome.  Each morning, we took advantage of the Continental Breakfast which was quite substancial and kept us going into the late afternoon.  Not only are the rooms clean, but quite as well.  We have stayed here many time and certainly plan to make it back again.  If we could give them 6 star, we would!!
Room tip: Rooms at the end of the halls have less foot traffic.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very noisy and no masks anywhere
Summary: The only good thing about this place was that the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately, we didn’t sleep much the nights we were there and left a day early because it was too noisy at night. The staff did nothing about a baseball team of 14-year-olds running up and down the halls from 10 PM until midnight, when I finally complained. They were aware of the problem but did nothing. The boys were screaming, yelling, slamming doors and literally sprinting up and down the hallways on multiple floors. Baseball team aside, the hotel was very noisy at night. Doors slamming, people talking, we could hear the people above us walking very loudly. It got so bad, that we left one night early and stayed somewhere else.  Our room was also missing a few items, such as a bar of soap, the “do not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review and for letting us know the areas where we need improvement. It seems as if our Front Desk & Housekeeping staff fell short of meeting your expectations as well as the high standards we set for ourselves, and for that, we deeply apologize. Our Night Auditor does make periodical walks around the property and throughout the hallways but if he doesn't hear disruptions during those "sweeps", it's near impossible to hear any disturbances from the front office so unfortunately, we must rely on other guests making us aware of these disruptions. As far as the other issues you brought to our attention, rest assured that they will be properly addressed with the appropriate department. Once again, I am very sorry that you had an unpleasant experience at our hotel.

Summary: I travel a ton for work and the service here was as good as it gets!! Jack was amazing and  treated my family GREAT!!  Room was excellent  as well and was a 5 min drive to everything from beach to the pier...
Manager Response: none

Summary: We travel to San Clemente once or twice a month and have stayed at several of the hotels.  Holiday Inn Express San Clemente is by far the best choice.  The rooms are recently remodeled and very clean.  The staff is amazing.  The housekeeping does a wonderful job and goes the extra mile to make sure rooms are sterilized.  The pool is crystal clear and plenty of pool towels to use while at the pool.  Breakfast in the morning is delicious and plentiful.  Wide variety of hot and cold breakfast choices.  Guzy, Kevin, Ernie and the rest of the staff treat me like family because I am at the hotel so often.  It is centrally located to all the restaurants and shopping in San Clemente and right next to The Outlets.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Sooo I stayed here early July the front desk team was awesome very helpful Jack was super kind and friendly got us into the room very efficiently great hair too beds are comfy and very clean room breakfast was amazing and the pool was heated just right all around great stay

The hotel is tucked in behind a shopping center and although my GPS told me I had arrived I couldn't see it behind the shops and the signage to find the driveway were small and the driveway could have been easily missed especially if you arrive after dark. When I arrived to check in the front desk clerk was busy with another guest and he never acknowledged my arrival or looked at me even though I was standing there for at least five mins finally another clerk came out of the office (right next to the front desk) to check me in. My card key had to be re-keyed every other time I used it and when I went to

Summary: We were looking for a place to stay by the beach in San Clemente for the Cars and Coffee. Every hotel/motel we called did not compare. The Holiday inn let us check in early, the room was spacious, it had a nice pool. They had a grab and go breakfast each morning.  Just down the hill, driveway they had a couple restaurants, a 99 cents store and even a walk in nail salon. The cars and coffee at the outlet stores was 5 min away and visible from the window. I liked it and would def stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok for one night family stay, unsuitable for couples getaway
Summary: It’s clean and recently remodeled but that’s the best I can say. I had the choice of 4 classes of room to reserve and I chose an executive king which was the best and most expensive available. When I checked in I asked for a quiet private room not facing the freeway and on the top floor. He said there was nothing  available higher than the 2nd floor and gave me my keys. Neither one worked so I went back and had them rekeyed. Second floor room has a great view of guess what—the freeway! The noise from it is all you hear. You feel very very far removed from the beach or anything fun or cute to walk to. You are up a big hill that bottoms out in a drab mini mall. It seems none or few of the rooms have decent views. That’s probably why despite all the balconies there is no balcony
Manager Response: Hello franktraveller,  Thank you for choosing our brand and going out of your way to leave us your insights.   We find ways for our guests to have an efficient and frictionless stay experience. It is saddening to know that we missed the mark this time.
